intro: Philodendron exile, commonly known as the Mexican beauty or the silver-leaf philodendron, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, heart-shaped leaves that often have a silvery or white variegation. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its foliage is often variegated with shades of green, white, and sometimes pink. Philodendron exile prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
